algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) using a queue to traverse the tree level by level.
Level-order traversal to calculate sum and count for each level.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the average value of nodes at each level of a binary tree.
problem_summary_technical: Perform a level-order traversal (BFS) of the binary tree. For each level, sum node values and divide by the count of nodes on that level.
key_insights: BFS is the most natural approach for level-based problems as it explores the tree layer by layer.
A queue is essential for BFS to maintain the order of nodes to visit at each level.
The key is to process all nodes at the current level before moving to the next, which can be achieved by using a temporary list or by knowing the size of the current level.
